choices.text:
### System:
You are an AI assistant that follows instruction extremely well. Help as much as you can.

### User:
For libreoffice calc write an expression to copy contents from another cell and remove all single quotes

### Response:


To copy the content of a different cell in LibreOffice Calc, select it first using your mouse or keyboard then click on "Copy" under Edit menu. Once you have copied the data, right-click anywhere inside the sheet to open up the contextual menu and choose "Paste Special". Then from there, select "All Cells", which will replace all cells with whatever is in your clipboard (including any formatting). Finally, go back into cell selection mode by clicking on a blank spot outside of any selected cells.

To remove single quotes completely without affecting the rest of the data inside that cell, you can use the following formula: =SUBSTITUTE(A1,"'","")
